tagLines: Spreading excitement and energy in human-centered design via innovative applications of modern open source technology and automation.

qualifiers: Responsible for automating, configuring, staging, orchestrating, and versioning all code releases for the team via DevOps platform (Jenkins and Hudson CI/CD Servers, Nexus, Apache Servers, Apache Maven and Ant, Gulp, NodeJS, Subversion, Enterprise GitHub, Webhooks, Linux Bash and Korn Shell)
Developed our team's automated DevOps pipeline to work within Capital One's secure architecture (AWS, cCloud, Linux Red Hat)
Designed and developed high quality, scalable enterprise web applications and services using the Scrum and Kanban methodologies in a mature agile environment

Developed reactive enterprise web applications that required a strong proficiency in Core Java, Java Spring Framework (REST, MVC, Springboot, Security), Web application languages and design (AngularJS, Javascript), X-Unit (JUnit, Jasmine, Protractor), Apache Tomcat Application and Web Servers, AWS (CloudFormation, Chef), JSON, and NoSQL & SQL (MongoDB, Terradata)
Developed applications that required a strong foundation in object-oriented design, data structures, algorithms, and complexity analysis (Core Java, AngularJS, Database Indexing)

Created human-centered, web-based interfaces to help visualize and manage various scaled agile-related processes using open sourced technology (HCI GOMs and KLM modeling, see open sourced technologies in grid below)
Utilized and created various micro-service-level, enterprise-level, and external web APIs (Jira API, VersionOne API, Internal REST API utilization)
Responsible and trusted for educating, briefing, and providing keynotes to non-technical persons and leadership on technical subject matter (VBA)
Frequently provided feedback to external agile content management software company (VersionOne) regarding Capital One's end-user experience
achievements: Notable Achievements: Contributed substantially to Capital One's first open sourced product – Hygieia – released during OSCON 2015

qualifiers: Managed corporate agile and waterfall portfolios across horizontal lines of businesses
Responsible for managing program-level change for two large integration portfolios using Clarity and VBA tools
Automated and leaned enterprise processes using BPM certified process management tools (BPM Lifecycle, XMR, SIPOC, RACI, Process Flow, CTQ)
Created enterprise, customer-facing middleware web services (Java Spring Framework, WSDL, SOAP)
Responsible for developing middleware integration services and mapping native to canonical data models in code (ICS Data Modeling Suite, XML Namespace, XSLT)

Developed web services that required a strong proficiency in core Java, Java Spring Framework (MVC, Security), WebServices (SOAP), JUnit, Weblogic Application Server, Oracle Service Bus, XSLT, and XML
Provided frequent feedback to external data modeling software company (ICS Data Modeling Suite) based on our end-user experience of software
Successfully operated in a new-but-maturing Scrum agile environment
B.S. in Information Science and Technology, focused in Information Systems
B.A. in Psychology
Extracurricular: 4 years in the PSU Marching Blue Band
Certifications: BPM (Business Process Management)
